title: Google\Cloud\Monitoring\V3\UptimeCheckConfig\HttpCheck
name: HttpCheck
description:
Information involved in an HTTP/HTTPS uptime check request.

Generated from protobuf message google.monitoring.v3.UptimeCheckConfig.HttpCheck

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.use_ssl
params.description: If true, use HTTPS instead of HTTP to run the check.

params.name: data.path
params.description: The path to the page to run the check against. Will be combined with the host (specified within the MonitoredResource) and port to construct the full URL. Optional (defaults to "/"). If the provided path does not begin with "/", it will be prepended automatically.

params.name: data.port
params.description: The port to the page to run the check against. Will be combined with host (specified within the MonitoredResource) and path to construct the full URL. Optional (defaults to 80 without SSL, or 443 with SSL).

params.name: data.auth_info
params.description: The authentication information. Optional when creating an HTTP check; defaults to empty.

params.name: data.mask_headers
params.description: Boolean specifiying whether to encrypt the header information. Encryption should be specified for any headers related to authentication that you do not wish to be seen when retrieving the configuration. The server will be responsible for encrypting the headers. On Get/List calls, if mask_headers is set to True then the headers will be obscured with **.

params.name: data.headers
params.description: The list of headers to send as part of the uptime check request. If two headers have the same key and different values, they should be entered as a single header, with the value being a comma-separated list of all the desired values as described at https://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616.txt (page 31). Entering two separate headers with the same key in a Create call will cause the first to be overwritten by the second. The maximum number of headers allowed is 100.

params.name: data.validate_ssl
params.description: Boolean specifying whether to validate SSL certificates. Only applies to uptime_url checks. If use_ssl is false, setting this to true has no effect.
